thread.title: Another bank fined over 1MDB; PAS-Bersatu deal; Umno leaders face the law
thread.title_full: Another bank fined over 1MDB; PAS-Bersatu deal; Umno leaders face the law

title: Another bank fined over 1MDB; PAS-Bersatu deal; Umno leaders face the law
text:
KINI ROUNDUP Here are the key headlines you may have missed yesterday, in brief. 
Another bank sanctioned over 1MDB 
The Swiss Financial Market Supervisory Authority fined Coutts & Co Limited over 1MDB-linked transactions it handled for Penang-born billionaire Jho Low. 
Ousted Mara chairperson Annuar Musa vowed to meet the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) after receiving a hero's welcome at Kuala Lumpur International Airport. 
Zailan Jauhari, a former special officer to Defence Minister Hishammuddin Hussein, pleaded not guilty to receiving RM80,000 bribes at the Shah Alam Sessions Court. 
In the wake of the arrest, Hishammuddin said he hoped there would be no scapegoats in the case. 
Gerakan Akarumbi Umno Malaysia president Zulkarnain Mahdar called on Bersih to take up alleged scandals of former prime minister Dr Mahathir Mohamad. 
Bersatu-PAS pact in the works 
Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (Bersatu) president Muhyiddin Yassin said an agreement to set up a technical committee with PAS on cooperation would help unite the opposition. 
Parti Amanah Negara deputy president Salahuddin Ayub was not opposed to the Bersatu-PAS plan but urged the final agreement to be expedited ahead of the general election. 
PKR president Azmin Ali, who had tirelessly tried to court PAS, welcomed the Bersatu-PAS deal. 
The Election Commission said it had sold 14 nomination forms for the Tanjung Datu by-election , which is to be held following the death of former Sarawak Chief Minister Adenan Satem. 
Meanwhile, Amanah announced that it will not be contesting in the by-election. 
Umno leaders to face the law 
Sungai Besar Umno chief Jamal Md Yunos was arrested for alleged gang robbery . 
This was over the raids Jamal conducted on what he claimed to be gambling dens in Taman Kosas, Ampang on Dec 29. 
Firdaus Tajuddin, son of Agriculture and Agro-based Industry Deputy Minister Tajuddin Abdul Rahman, is also expected to be charged soon for allegedly rioting on Parliament grounds. 
Last November, Firdaus led a group of people claiming to be from Pasir Salak and confronted Shah Alam MP Khalid Samad as he arrived in Parliament for allegedly insulting his father. Other Kinibites 
The lion dance troupe that performed for Najib Abdul Razak decried claims they snubbed the prime minister. 
Penang Chief Minister Lim Guan Eng rebuffed Federal Territories Minister Tengku Adnan Tengku Mansor's suggestion that the state be turned into a federal territory. 
Gerakan Youth deputy chief Andy Yong rebutted accusations that Tengku Adnan insulted the Yang Di-Pertua Negeri for making the ‘turn Penang into federal territory’ proposal. 
DAP's Bilut assemblyperson Chow Yu Hui objected to his party protesting at the US embassy over the country's ban on seven Muslim countries. 
Meanwhile, PAS submitted a memorandum to the US embassy to protest the ban . 
Looking ahead 
De facto PKR leader Anwar Ibrahim's defamation suit against Umno Youth chief Khairy Jamaluddin continues. 
Jamal will be brought before the Ampang Magistrate Court where police are expected to ask for remand. 
Najib and PAS president Abdul Hadi Awang will again share the same stage to send off a humanitarian flotilla to Myanmar.
